issue.title: Make /etc/resolv.conf reading more robust

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:
It is possible that /etc/resolv.conf is missing or cannot be read, in which case `ResolvConf.system()` will throw an exception. We need to handle that exception in `DefaultDnsServerAddressStreamProvider`, since exceptions thrown from a static initializer can become `NoClassDefFoundError`.

Modification:
Catch the exception that `ResolvConf.system()` might throw, an fall back to JNDI in that case.

Result:
No more `NoClassDefFoundError` being thrown when `/etc/resolv.conf` cannot be read for any reason.

Fixes #13949

issue.title: Upgrade Netty.

repository.name: common
repository.description: Common utilities library containing metrics, config and utils

issue.body: Updating netty to fix https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/13949 by bumping up the version to [v4.1.112.Final](https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/io.netty/netty-all/4.1.112.Final)
